entry.title: Tonk Is Building a Provability-Focused Onchain Nintendo Emulator
entry.summary: Tonk, a programming collective focusing on onchain gaming, has announced a blockchain-based Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) emulator called Dappicom. The app, being coded using Noir, a smart contract-enabled privacy-focused language, will allow players to prove they have achieved in-game milestones without showing how. Tonk Announces Dappicom, a Provability-Focused NES Emulator Tonk, a gaming-oriented programming team, has announced it is working on Dappicom, a Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) emulator that will allow users to play and enjoy old gaming classics onchain. Furthermore, Tonk focuses on the probability part of the gaming equation, using mathematical proofs to power this part of its functionality. Dappicom is being coded using Noir, a language that uses zero-knowledge (ZK‚Ä¶

entry.title: FTX‚Äôs Sam Bankman-Fried Trial Schedule Released: Here Are The Important Dates To Note
entry.summary:
The trial of the former CEO of defunct crypto exchange FTX Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF) has taken full shape with just less than a week before it commences. In preparation, the court has released the trial calendar, which shows how long the case is expected to last.¬†
A Close Look At The Calendar
According to the court document dated September 28, the trial is set to begin on October 4 and end on November 9. Although the first court session is set to occur on October 3, that day is solely set for Jury selection and not when the hearing will commence.¬†
Once that is done, Judge Kaplan, the judge in charge of SBF‚Äôs case, alongside the Jury, will begin hearing the Prosecution‚Äôs case against Sam Bankman-Fried on October 4. SBF‚Äôs lawyers are also expected to open their defense at some point.¬†
‚Ä¶

entry.title: Non-Regulation of Web3 Space Making ‚ÄòMainstream Adoption Harder‚Äô Says AGG‚Äôs Jack Vinijtrongjit
entry.summary:
According to Jack Vinijtrongjit, the co-founder and CEO of the Web3 infrastructure company AAG, more prospective users will be drawn to decentralized finance (defi) and non-fungible tokens (NFTs) if tools that help them avoid falling prey to scammers are developed and deployed. Vinijtrongjit argued that the need for such tools will even become ‚Äúmore crucial‚Äù if and when the much-talked-about widespread adoption of Web3 becomes a reality.
Onus on Industry Participants
While he acknowledged the key role that education can play in making Web3 a safer space for new users, Vinijtrongjit insisted that the onus for solving this problem rests on the shoulders of industry participants. He told Bitcoin.com News that this is especially true at the latter stages of mainstream adoption of emerging ‚Ä¶

entry.title: SEC Delays Bitcoin Spot ETFs From BlackRock And Others, Here‚Äôs Why
entry.summary:
The United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has once again deferred its decisions regarding multiple proposals for spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) from leading financial institutions, including BlackRock. This move by the SEC precedes an impending government shutdown, which is anticipated to influence the functioning of the country‚Äôs financial regulators and other federal agencies.
James Seyffart, a Bloomberg ETF analyst, has been actively providing updates on the situation through his X (formerly Twitter) account. Among the firms mentioned in Seyffart‚Äôs tweets, BlackRock, Bitwise Invest, Invesco, and Galaxy Digital have already received delay orders from the SEC.
Seyffart predicts that the remaining applications from WisdomTree, VanEck, and Fidelity will likel‚Ä¶

entry.title: SEC Delays Decision on Spot Bitcoin ETF Proposal
entry.summary: The United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has announced a delay in its decision on several proposals for spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs). The affected applicants include financial giants like BlackRock, Invesco, Bitwise, and Valkyrie. SEC Postpones Review of Bitcoin ETF Proposals The SEC's decision to postpone the review process occurred two weeks ahead of the scheduled second deadline. It was originally arranged for October 16-19. Analysts suggest that these delays are directly tied to the looming threat of a government shutdown in the United States. It is expected to occur on October 1 if Congress fails to pass the necessary funding bills. The ongoing deadlock in Congress over these bills has created a unstable situation for federal ag‚Ä¶

entry.title: US Spy Agency Plans to Launch Generative AI Tool to Amplify Intelligence Gathering
entry.summary:
Reports indicate that the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency is poised to unveil a generative artificial intelligence (AI) tool, akin to Openai‚Äôs Chatgpt, to significantly enhance investigative efforts. Randy Nixon, the head of the CIA‚Äôs Open-Source Enterprise division, explained that this innovation will empower users to effortlessly trace back to the original sources of the information they are amassing.
CIA Eyes Generative AI Technology
The CIA is on track to unveil a generative AI chatbot, echoing the capabilities of OpenAI‚Äôs Chatgpt or Anthropic‚Äôs Claude. The spotlight on AI has intensified in 2023, and the U.S. government‚Äôs intelligence arm is gearing up to launch its distinct AI asset. This tool, however, will remain off-limits to U.S. bureaucrats and the general populace, with Ni‚Ä¶

entry.title: Venezuelan Crypto Watchdog Sunacrip Extends Restructuring Period; Community Asks for Clarity
entry.summary:
The Venezuelan government has officially announced the extension of the restructuring period for Sunacrip ‚Äî the national cryptocurrency watchdog ‚Äî by six months more due to the link of its former head with a corruption scheme. Asonacrip, a national crypto association, is asking Sunacrip to open communication channels with the community affected by its actions.
Venezuelan Government Extends Sunacrip Intervention by Six Months
The Venezuelan government has announced the extension of the restructuring of Sunacrip, the cryptocurrency watchdog of the country, by six months more. The executive order, which extended the intervention, also ratified each member of the restructuring board in their charges. Sunacrip will now have until next March to complete its restructuring processes.
Sunacri‚Ä¶

Crypto exchange Binance is closing down all exchange services and business lines in Russia. The company has entered into a sales agreement with Commex. Binance Fully Exiting Russia
Cryptocurrency exchange Binance announced Wednesday that it will fully exit Russia. According to the announcement: ‚Äú has entered into an agreement to sell the entirety of its Russia business to Commex.‚Äù According to its website, Commex is ‚Äúa centralized cryptocurrency exchange backed by top-tier crypto VC.‚Äù

entry.title: Surprise: BIS Used Ethereum Testnet And Curve Finance‚Äôs Code In CBDC Pilot
entry.summary:
Project Mariana, an initiative whose goal was to explore the application of central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) in enhancing the efficiency and security of cross-border payments, has been successfully concluded, the Bank of France has¬†confirmed.
Even as this pilot comes to an end, one developer¬†notes¬†that the Bank of International Settlements (BIS) reportedly utilized the public Ethereum Sepolia testnet and Curve Finance‚Äôs smart contracts as the base of Project Mariana, testing and measuring the efficacy of cross-border Forex automated market maker (AMM) pilot.
The CBDC project depended on Curve Finance‚Äôs code. Even so, the BIS wanted to keep the use of Curve‚Äôs framework private. So far, there has been no comment from Curve Finance or any Ethereum core developers regarding Proje‚Ä¶

entry.title: Coinbase Secures Regulatory Approval For Retail Perpetual Futures Trading
entry.summary:
Coinbase, the renowned cryptocurrency trading platform, has announced that its Bermuda-based entity, Coinbase International Exchange, has received regulatory approval from the Bermuda Monetary Authority (BAM) to offer perpetual futures to retail customers outside the United States.¬†
The move marks Coinbase‚Äôs entry into the rapidly growing market for perpetual futures, which have become dominant in cryptocurrency trading abroad.¬†
According to Barron‚Äôs report, this development not only positions the US-based exchange as a direct competitor to Binance, the current leader in the crypto perpetual-futures market, but also signifies the platform‚Äôs expansion strategy and commitment to providing a comprehensive range of services to its global user base.
Coinbase Expands Reach Into Lucrative‚Ä¶

entry.title: U.S. House Bill Seeks Centralized Record of Off-Chain Crypto Transactions
entry.summary: It would be hard for a big exchange to repeat an FTX collapse if the firm‚Äôs internal flow of crypto assets was also reported to an outside repository that U.S. regulators could see. That‚Äôs the idea behind new legislation from Rep. Don Beyer (D-Va.) that would force exchanges to share the movement of digital assets now only recorded on their own ledgers.

entry.title: Decentralize Derivatives Trading with Custom Blockchain
entry.summary: David Gogel of dYdX discusses how the decentralized exchange is building a custom blockchain to fully decentralize derivatives trading. He explained how the new dYdX chain will allow validators to run order books in memory, enabling decentralized order matching at scale. This shift aims to increase security and transparency for traders while maintaining the performance of centralized exchanges.

entry.title: India's 1% Crypto Tax Has Been a Nightmare for High-Frequency Traders, Says Shardeum CEO
entry.summary: As India figures out its regulatory approach to the crypto industry, one thing is clear to Shardeum co-founder Nischal Shetty: ‚ÄúIf you're a high-frequency trader, you can't afford to lose a percentage every time you sell,‚Äù he told Decrypt's Andre Beganski at Messari Mainnet in New York. ‚ÄúThat's something that's caused a lot of issues.‚Äù

entry.title: Newly Partnered with Visa, Solana Focuses on Reliability
entry.summary: Solana has improved network reliability through upgrades like Quick and local fee markets. It recently partnered with Visa to allow settling transactions in USDC on Solana. This could enable merchants to receive instant payments and save on credit card processing fees. Stacy Elliott spoke with Austin Federa, Head of Strategy for the Solana Foundation, at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Most Crypto Users Don't Trust Themselves to Keep Their Seed Phrase Safe: Ledger CEO
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Ledger CEO Pascal Gauthier to discuss crypto custody post-FTX, and the hardware wallet manufacturer's controversial Ledger Recover service.

entry.title: Crypto Accounting Challenges and Opportunities
entry.summary: As crypto matures, accounting and tax regulations are evolving. Amy Kalnoki of Bitwave explains how her company helps crypto companies properly account for digital assets. She notes the importance of flexibility as new crypto assets emerge and regulations change. Stacy Elliott interviewed her at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Base as a 'Bridge, Not an Island'
entry.summary: Coinbase's Jesse Pollak, creator of layer-2 blockchain Base, says the launch of the network has exceeded expectations, even if plans changed along the way. He believes Arbitrum One will help bring billions onto blockchain by enabling seamless user experiences. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Explosive Growth Ahead for Enterprise Blockchain
entry.summary: Paul Brody drives Ernst & Young (EY) initiatives and investments in blockchain technology across consulting, audit, and tax business lines. He says enterprise blockchain adoption is nearing an inflection point. Brody believes blockchains will one day handle 40 billion transactions daily across industries like automotive and pharma. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Building a Developer-Friendly zkRollup to Scale Ethereum
entry.summary: Daniel Helm, head of Developer Relations at Scroll, discussess how they are building a zkRollup to scale Ethereum transactions and lower fees. He explained their focus on creating a seamless developer experience by maintaining Ethereum's ethos and tooling. Scroll aims to launch their mainnet soon, providing more scalable blockspace for Ethereum developers. Stacy Elliott of Decrypt interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Regulation Threatens U.S. Dominance of Financial Markets, Says CoinRoutes CEO
entry.summary: Dave Weisberger, Co-Founder and CEO of CoinRoutes, argued that excessive regulation in the U.S. threatens to undermine the country's long-standing dominance in global financial markets. He warned that other countries are embracing blockchain and crypto to build more efficient digital markets, which could cause the US to lose its competitive edge and trillions in GDP. Weisberger said CoinRoutes is now focusing more on expanding internationally due to restrictive policies in the U.S. He was interviewed by Andr√© Beganski of Decrypt at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Bitcoin's Narrative Is Shifting Towards Layer-2 Solutions
entry.summary: Rich Rines, original Core DAO contributor and former Coinbase engineer, discusses how the narrative around Bitcoin is shifting in 2023. While Bitcoin remains digital gold, new layer 2 solutions are emerging to unlock more utility and value from the huge amounts of capital stored in Bitcoin. He says these innovations can benefit Bitcoin holders while keeping Bitcoin maximalists happy by building outside the base layer. Andr√© Beganski interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: We Need to Start Thinking About How we Make Crypto Easy to Use: Robinhood Crypto General Manager
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Robinhood Crypto general manager Johann Kerbrat at Messari Mainnet 2023, to talk about the trading platform's crypto wallet, onboarding new users through simplicity, and keeping platform fees sustainable.

entry.title: On-Chain Gaming Poised for Mass Adoption
entry.summary: Jack O'Holleran is CEO and co-founder of SKALE Labs. He explains how on-chain gaming is ready for the mainstream after overcoming early challenges like high fees and poor user experience. Companies can now build blockchain games that look and feel like traditional games, and scalability improvements allow games to support hundreds of millions of players without performance issues. He was interviewed by Andr√© Beganski at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: New Blockchains Boom Creates Opportunity and Challenges
entry.summary: Billy Sebell of the XDC Foundation discussed the proliferation of new layer-1 and layer-2 blockchain solutions. While this expands possibilities, he noted projects must still attract users amidst growing competition. Sebell highlighted the benefits of targeting niche use cases and bringing real-world assets on-chain via tokenization. He was interviewed by Andr√© Beganski of Decrypt at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Accessible Self-Custody for Crypto
entry.summary: Dave Lemke is the CFO & CCO at Giddy, creators of a crypto wallet with decentralized private key security. He explains how their solution allows self-custody while still being recoverable. He highlighted increasing demand for self-custody after the FTX collapse. Lemke also touched on upcoming US crypto regulations and Getty's roadmap to simplify staking and other complex processes. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Defi Education Fund Advocates for Responsible Crypto Regulation
entry.summary: Amanda Tuminelli of the Defi Education Fund discusses the need for sensible crypto regulation. She says regulators should work with the industry to understand how protocols work before proposing expansive rules that could stifle innovation. Stacy Elliott of Decrypt interviewed her at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Train Your Own AI-Powered Fighter? Inside AI Arena
entry.summary: What is AI Arena? Decrypt's Kate Irwin dives into the upcoming video game in an interview with the game's founders, AI Arena CEO Brandon Da Silva and COO Wei Xie.

entry.title: DeFi Lenders and Borrowers Are More Cautious Than Ever. Maple Finance's Sidney Powell Explains Why
entry.summary: Sidney Powell, co-founder of DeFi lender Maple Finance, sits down with Decrypt reporter Andr√© Beganski to talk risk management in DeFi and how the crypto lending and borrowing landscape has changed within the last year.
